abstract:
Large-scale datasets with multi-labels are becoming readily available, and
the demand for large-scale multi-label classification algorithm is also
increasing. In this work, we propose to utilize a single-layer Neural Networks
approach in large-scale multi-label text classification tasks with recently
proposed learning techniques. We carried out experiments on six textual
datasets with varying characteristics and size, and show that a simple Neural
Networks model equipped with recent advanced techniques for Neural Networks
components such as activation layer, optimization, and generalization
algorithms performs as well as or even outperforms the previous
state-of-the-art approaches on large-scale datasets with diverse
characteristics.
